definition: to be more of a hindrance than a help
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: Because, slowly but surely, you are doing your gender a disservice.
sentences.chinese: 因爲慢慢你會發現你無疑在給你的男性魅力幫倒忙。

sentences.english: Don't speak, you will do a disservice to him.
sentences.chinese: 不要再說了，你只會給他幫倒忙。

sentences.english: When they do help with the work, it isn't good.
sentences.chinese: 當他們試圖幫忙的時候，總會幫倒忙。

sentences.english: Job seekers do themselves a disservice when they send out résumés with more information than they need.
sentences.chinese: 求職者在簡歷中包含過量的信息是在給自己幫倒忙。

sentences.english: Low Calorie diet plans are simply counter-productive.
sentences.chinese: 低卡路里飲食是典型的幫倒忙。
